revised_title: Meynert Cells in Monkey Striate Cortex Project to the Superior Colliculus
tldr: The study found that in the striate visual cortex of monkeys, both layer V and layer VI neurons project to the superior colliculus. Among these, the layer VI neurons, known as Meynert cells, have distinct morphological and size differences compared to layer V neurons. This discovery suggests that Meynert cells may provide a more direct pathway to the superior colliculus for visual information than layer V neurons.
